column4: hi folks, I have Ubuntu 8.10 and I wanted to test Mandriva. So I installed it on another partition and during the installation process it asked me if I want to install the Boot Loader. I chose No, then after installation GRUB gave me error 15. So I booted from Ubuntu Live CD and reinstalled GRUB. Now I can only see Ubunut and WinXP in GRUB. How can I add Mandriva to GRUB so I can boot it?
you need to edit /boot/grub/menu.lst
how to do that?
Open it with a text editor like nano or gedit...
then copy the entry for Ubutnu and change the relevant bits to point to the Mandriva parition and rename it
how can I know the "relevant" bits for Mandriva?
You need to know which disk and partition it is installed to
it's on the same disk
but different partition
is there any tutorial on this topic?
For instance, if its installed to the third parition of the first disk, then you need the following line:
root    (hd0,2)
